tool_description: Determine stock sentiment from financial news article text. This API uses a Naive Bayes classifier to determine positive/negative sentiment. Excerpts from hundreds of financial news articles were used to train the model.
name: Stock News Sentiment Analysis
title: Stock News Sentiment Analysis

api_list.name: Simple Sentiment Data
api_list.description:
This endpoint will return true/false values for whether the text has positive sentiment (positiveResult) or negative sentiment (negativeResult).
The stopwords field allows for custom stop words that are removed from the text before analyzing. If not included in the request, a default list of stop words is used.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://stock-news-sentiment-analysis.p.rapidapi.com/simple"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "stock-news-sentiment-analysis.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Detailed Sentiment Data
api_list.description:
This endpoint will return true/false values for whether the text has positive sentiment (positiveResult) or negative sentiment (negativeResult).
Additionally, this endpoint will return lists of the words not tested (wordsRemoved) and words tested (wordsTested) as well as the calculated log probabilities of positive (positiveLogProb) and negative (negativeLogProb) sentiment. posWordRank ranks words in order from most likely to least likely to appear in positive news articles. negWordRank ranks words in order from  most likely to least likely to appear in negative news articles.
The stopwords field allows for custom stop words that are removed from the text before analyzing. If not included in the request, a default list of stop words is used.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://stock-news-sentiment-analysis.p.rapidapi.com/detailed"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "stock-news-sentiment-analysis.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
